author: pietjepuk
content: I think one of Erigon team's ideas/goals was being able to skip the import step, by being smart about how the files are laid out such that you can access them directly. So that makes for at least _two_ storage formats for historical blocks. See https://discord.com/channels/595666850260713488/745077610685661265/919230902285008976

author: vorot93
content: The whole point is that you shouldn’t _import_ anything, but use the downloaded files directly

author: ajsutton
content: The downside of that is that then the database format is fixed and has to be changed in lockstep across all clients.  If we'd done this a while back Erigon wouldn't be able to exist since it depends on using a different approach to storage.

author: bridge-bot
content: <timbeiko> Yeah, it doesn’t seem like that high of an overhead to just serve different formats of DBs

author: bridge-bot
content: <timbeiko> Even if it’s one per client, it means like 5 format

author: bridge-bot
content: <timbeiko> It’s not ideal, but better than cementing certain DB architectures
